required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A FIH Study of YH35324 in Atopic Healthy Subjects or Subjects With Mild Allergic Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-Human, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo/Active Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics Following Subcutaneous Injections of YH35324 in Atopic Healthy Subjects or Subjects With Mild Allergic Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD following subcutaneous injections of YH35324 in atopic healthy subjects or adult subjects with mild allergic diseases. Eligible subjects will be randomized to the YH35324 group, the placebo group, or the omalizumab group.

detailed_description.textblock: YH35324 is a drug under development as a novel therapeutic agent for various IgE-mediated allergic diseases. Since YH35324 has a high binding affinity to human IgE, it prevents serum IgE from binding to receptors on mast cells and basophil, thereby inhibiting histamine release caused by degranulation when exposed to allergens Based on its non-clinical study results, this study aims to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD following subcutaneous injections of YH35324 in atopic healthy subjects or subjects with mild allergic diseases.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability following single administration of YH35324
primary_outcome.time_frame: Occurrence and severity of adverse events will be observed for 113 days after administration
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence and severity of adverse events (AEs)

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the PK of YH35324
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Serum concentrations of YH35324 will be observed for 113 days after administration

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the PD of YH35324
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in serum Free/Total IgE level will be observed for 113 days after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum Free/Total IgE level

other_outcome.measure: To explore the PD of YH35324
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes in FcεRI expression will be observed for 57days after administration

other_outcome.measure: To explore inhibition on allergens (allergy antigens) of YH35324
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes in allergen-induced skin prick wheal response will be observed for 57 days after administration
other_outcome.description: Changes in allergen-induced skin prick wheal response

other_outcome.measure: To explore the immunogenicity of YH35324
other_outcome.time_frame: Incidence of serum Anti-YH35324 antibodies will be observed for 113 Days after administration

other_outcome.measure: To explore inhibition on allergens (allergy antigens) of YH35324
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes in allergen-induced serum allergen specific IgE level will be observed for 57 days after administration
other_outcome.description: Changes in serum allergen specific IgE level

clinical_study.condition: Adult Subjects With Mild Allergic Diseases

arm_group.description: Part A: A single dose of the YH35324 will be administered subcutaneously in 5 dose groups (0.3, 1, 3, 6, and 9 mg/kg), and a dose will be escalated in a stepwise manner from low to high doses Part B: A single dose of the YH35324 will be administered subcutaneously. The dose of YH35324 will be determined after the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD data in Part A are reviewed

Part A: A single dose of the Placebo will be administered subcutaneously in 5 Cohorts(Dose groups=0.3, 1, 3, 6, and 9 mg/kg), and a dose will be escalated in a stepwise manner from low to high doses Part B: Placebo is not administered in Part B

Part A: A single fixed dose of the Omalizumab 300mg will be administered subcutaneously in 4 Cohorts(Dose groups of YH35324=1, 3, 6, and 9 mg/kg) Part B: A single dose of the Omalizumab 300mg will be administered subcutaneously.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous injection of None of active ingredient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 19~55 years old, Atopic Healthy Subjects or Subjects With Mild Allergic Diseases
- Serum total IgE level of 30 to 700 IU/mL or > 700 IU/mL
- Signed the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hyperimmunoglobulin E syndrome or malignancy
- Positive drug screen result
- AST or ALT > 1.5 * Upper normal range
- eGFR < 60mL/min/1.73m2
- Allergy immunotherapy initiated or Administration of a live vaccine within 3 months prior to randomization
- History of participation in another clinical trial within 6 months prior to randomization

facility.name: Severance Hospital, Yonsei University Health System

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (including data dictionaries) that underline the results reported in study-related publications will be made available during the period beginning 1 year and ending 5 years after all trial primary and secondary endpoints were assessed. Only requests from researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal will be reviewed and approved by the sponsor. The analysis type should be in accordance with aims in the proposal approved by the sponsor. Proposals should be directed to yhcho@yuhan.co.kr. A summary of the study results will be posted in the publicly accessible database (i.e. clinicaltrials.gov) no later than 1 year after the study's primary completion date.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 1 year and ending 5 years after all trial endpoints were assessed
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Only requests from researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal will be reviewed and approved by the sponsor. The analysis type should be in accordance with aims in the proposal approved by the sponsor. Proposals should be directed to yhcho@yuhan.co.kr.
